text: {{Infobox settlement | official_name = Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins Region | native_name = | native_name_lang = es | settlement_type = Region of Chile | seat_type = Capital | seat = Rancagua | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | parts_type = Provinces | parts = Cachapoal, Colchagua, Cardenal Caro | leader_title = Presidential Regional Delegate | leader_name = Fabio López | leader_party = Independent | image_skyline = File:Rio_Claro_O%27Higgins.jpg | image_caption = Río Claro | image_flag = Flag of O'Higgins Region, Chile.svg | flag_size = 120px | flag_alt = Flag of Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins Region | image_shield = Coat of arms of O'Higgins Region, Chile.svg | shield_size = 75px | shield_alt = Coat of Arms of Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins Region | image_map = OHiggins in Chile 2018.svg | mapsize = 250px | map_caption = Map of Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins Region | area_total_km2 = 16387.0 | area_footnotes = | area_rank = 14 | elevation_min_footnotes = | elevation_max_footnotes = | elevation_max_m = | elevation_min_m = 0 | population_total = 908545 | population_as_of = 2017 | population_footnotes = | population_rank = 6 | population_density_km2 = auto | blank_name_sec1 = HDI (2019) | blank_info_sec1 = 0.820 | website = Official website | iso_code = CL-LI | footnotes = }} The VI Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins Region (), often shortened to O'Higgins Region, is one of Chile's 15 first-order administrative divisions. It is named in honour of Bernardo O'Higgins Riquelme, one of Chile's founders. The capital and largest city of the region is Rancagua. The second major city is San Fernando. ==History== In 1880, the old "O'Higgins Province" was created with the territory of the present Cachapoal Province. In 1974, with the creation of the Regions of Chile, it became, together with the Colchagua Province, the new Region VI, known since then as Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins Region. ==Geography== The O'Higgins Region is bordered to the west by the Pacific Ocean, to the east by Argentina, to the north by the Valparaíso and Santiago Metropolitan Regions, and to the south by the Maule Region. The main rivers are the Cachapoal and Tinguiririca. ==Population== , there were (estimated) 918,751 persons living in the region, for a population density of inhabitants/km². The largest city in the region is its capital, Rancagua, with 206,971 inhabitants (2002 census). Other cities are San Fernando (49,519) and Rengo (30,891). ==Administration== The O’Higgins region is divided in three provinces: Cachapoal, Cardenal Caro and Colchagua.
